image.altText: A man wearing a polo shirt with the logo 'MTP' sits in the driver's seat of a car.

props.synopsis: Differing promises for roads and public transport have become key points of contention and difference between ACT Labor, the Canberra Liberals and the ACT Greens in the coming territory election.

title.children: If York catches a bus to work, it takes more than an hour. It takes just 25 minutes for him to drive

image.altText: People dressed in bright rainbow colours stand on a rainbow mural in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The Fair Day at Canberra pride festival SpringOut will no longer have a police presence after some members of the LGBTQIA+ community raised concerns.

title.children: 'There is genuine fear about having cops there': Police asked not to attend Canberra pride festival

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff told a News Corp editor that the ACT's former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold "wrought evil" and was "eager to lie to jail a man who may be innocent," court documents have revealed.

title.children: 'This is insanity': Court documents reveal texts and emails between Lehrmann inquiry chair and News Corp journalists

image.altText: A police officer in gloves pushes a knife from a road into a pipe next to a yellow evidence marker.

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man in a serious but stable condition in Canberra Hospital after a stabbing attack in Queanbeyan overnight.

title.children: Passing motorist 'possibly saved man's life' after stabbing attack in Queanbeyan

image.altText: A green field beside a road in a suburb development.

props.synopsis: A new site has been found for Bungendore's controversial high school after years of community division.

title.children: New location found for Bungendore high school after years of community division

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old man was arrested in August during an incident where he allegedly hit a woman in the head with a hammer and stabbed her multiple times while she was locked in a Canberra hotel room.

title.children: Canberra man granted bail for allegedly hitting woman with hammer while she was locked in hotel room

image.altText: A concept drawing of a sporting stadium at night.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals have committed to delivering a new 30,000-seat stadium at Acton Waterfront if they are successful in next month's ACT election.

title.children: 'You can't just plonk a stadium anywhere': Labor dismisses city stadium plan from Canberra Liberals

image.altText: Kikkert

props.synopsis: Just weeks out from the October election, the Canberra Liberals have dumped MLA Elizabeth Kikkert, saying they acted on allegations about donations and electoral expenditure obligations and "workplace behaviour''.

title.children: Canberra Liberals disendorse MLA Elizabeth Kikkert, alleging concerns about donations and 'workplace behaviour'

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The malicious release of personal data online, known as doxxing, will be outlawed and attract up to seven years in jail under new legislation being introduced to federal parliament on Thursday.

title.children: Federal government to outlaw doxxing, impose up to seven years' jail for malicious sharing of personal data

image.altText: Kamala Harris after the debate

props.synopsis: The stakes were higher for Democrat candidate Kamala Harris in the US presidential debate: she has a tougher audience to win over than Republican Donald Trump does.

title.children: Harris had one mission in the debate — to reach middle Americans better than Trump could

image.altText: A tiny lizard sits in a man's hand.

props.synopsis: A new study reveals the scale of Australia wildlife being smuggled overseas, with dozens of species recorded for the first time. But government authorities insist its crackdown is working.

title.children: 'Something is increasing the trade': First detailed study reveals scale of Australian species for sale overseas

image.altText: Michelle Rowland stands in a Parliament House courtyard wearing red.

props.synopsis: Proposed laws set to be introduced to parliament on Thursday would grant Australia's media watchdog greater powers to force tech companies to crack down on misinformation and disinformation.

title.children: Social media companies could be fined for not cracking down on misinformation under new bill

image.altText: A woman runs as police horses move behind her.

props.synopsis: Police are expected to maintain their presence outside the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre today after hundreds of officers clashed with anti-war protesters on Wednesday, resulting in dozens of injuries and arrests.

title.children: Police maintain presence at Melbourne defence expo as human rights groups condemn 'excessive' force

image.altText: A bald man with a head tattoo stands between two pacific island men wearing Leis on a street corner/

props.synopsis: While the live music industry used to be in good shape, the pandemic had a massive impact, shuttering venues around the country. A cost of living crisis is also taking a toll.

title.children: Australian live music venues are going out of business. Is a levy on bigger shows the answer?

image.altText: A womanan uses her phone as she passes a large and illuminated Apple logo

props.synopsis: A tax deal worth billions between Ireland and the maker of iPhones was upheld as illegal by an EU court, meaning an accounting exercise worth $21 billion.

title.children: How Apple paid less than 1 per cent tax in Ireland — and ended up owing billions

image.altText: an upset woman cries out the front of a courthouse

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button was behind the wheel of a bus returning from a wedding when it flipped on a roundabout, killing 10 passengers and injuring 25 others.

title.children: Families surprised by bus driver's 32-year sentence for killing their loved ones

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff told a News Corp editor that the ACT's former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold "wrought evil" and was "eager to lie to jail a man who may be innocent," court documents have revealed.

title.children: 'This is insanity': Court documents reveal texts and emails between Lehrmann inquiry chair and News Corp journalists

image.altText: Clothes hanging on washing lines strung between palm trees above sand.

props.synopsis: A new agreement allowing Tuvaluans to migrate to Australia has come into effect but there are warnings about the challenges that come with such a big move.

title.children: Tuvaluans are preparing to leave their paradise for Australia — but some warn it will be 'very tough'

props.synopsis: A new wave of construction is sweeping Bali, carving up rice fields and prime beachfront land for 'Insta-grammable' villas, resorts and massive tourism projects.

title.children: Once voted 'the most beautiful beach in the world', some fear Bali's plans could ruin it

image.altText: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi wears a graduation cap and a keffiyeh and holds a bunch of pink flowers while standing on a roadside.

props.synopsis: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi's family called for an independent investigation into her death after the Israel Defense Forces released its preliminary findings.

title.children: Biden seeks 'full accountability' from Israel over shooting of American activist in West Bank

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek in a white jacket.

props.synopsis: The federal government's signature nature protection reforms are on the cusp of collapsing, with Labor increasingly ready to walk away if it cannot do a deal with the Coalition.

title.children: Dutton says Albanese can't do a deal with Greens on nature bill without hurting Labor's political fortunes

image.altText: Two paramedics wheel stretcher beds to an ambulance on a dark street.

props.synopsis: Two of three children who were rescued from a burning home in Melbourne's north-west earlier this week have died in hospital.

title.children: Two children have died days after rescue from house fire in Melbourne's north-west

image.altText: A white and purple building with a sign for 'GISB HOLDINGS' on the front

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 police conducted the raids on 20 welfare homes, resulting in 171 arrests.

title.children: More than 400 minors suspected of being abused rescued by Malaysian authorities in mass raids

image.altText: A collage of three musicians

props.synopsis: Fortnight is nominated in nine different categories at the MTV Video Music Awards, while Olivia Rodrigo, Chappell Roan, Charli XCX, Eminem and *NSYNC are also up for awards.

title.children: See the MTV VMA nominees, from Taylor Swift & Post Malone to Taylor Swift & Post Malone

image.altText: A man pushes a stack of plyboards in flood following a typhoon.

props.synopsis: The death toll in Vietnam from Asia's worst storm this year reaches 152, with torrents of rain triggering floods and landslides, burying homes, sweeping away a bridge and now threatening the capital Hanoi.

title.children: Typhoon Yagi unleashes destruction in Vietnam, kills at least 152

image.altText: Two men wearing suits conversing next to a train

props.synopsis: The US and UK's chief foreign affairs advisors visit Ukraine to discuss the country's military needs in its fight against Russia.

title.children: Top US, UK diplomats make rare joint visit to Kyiv as Ukraine appeals for right to fire long-range missiles into Russia

image.altText: Prescription medicines

props.synopsis: Here’s what a review of assessment processes for medicines and vaccines suggested could be done to reduce PBS listing wait times.

title.children: New medicines could be PBS-listed in just four weeks if a 'visionary' proposal is adopted

image.altText: A blonde woman smiling at night

props.synopsis: Less than a month after the NSW Liberals bungled her local government campaign, Georgia Ryburn has won preselection to run for the seat of Pittwater for the party in next month's state by-election.

title.children: The Liberals bungled her council nomination. Now they've tapped her for a key seat in next month's NSW by-election

image.altText: A beluga whale being fed fish from a boat.

props.synopsis: Hvaldimir, who rose to fame in 2019 for his friendly antics, was found dead on August 31 by fishermen who dragged his body ashore to Risavika Port.

title.children: No indication that Russian 'spy whale' Hvaldimir was shot in Norway, local police say

image.altText: An aerial view of the town of Whyalla.

props.synopsis: Child protection authorities say the death of a three-year-old in regional SA is a "significant incident" but are refusing to publicly release information about the case.

title.children: Department refuses to answer questions about 3yo girl's death in regional SA

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's Productivity Commission defends the economics profession, saying it will have valuable contributions to make to the big problems of the 21st century.

title.children: 'Some of the criticisms … are well justified': Australia's Productivity Commission head defends economists

image.altText: A white cup full of coffee sits on a saucer on a bench nest to other coffe-making supplies.

props.synopsis: Your morning cup of coffee could soon get even better, thanks to scientists who have mapped the genome of the arabica plant.

title.children: Better coffee on the cards as researchers crack arabica's genetic code

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: David Speirs says he's taking time away from work to concentrate on his health days after a video — which appears to depict him snorting from a plate — emerges. He has previously strenuously denied wrongdoing, reportedly telling News Corp the video is a deepfake.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader takes medical leave two days after 'deepfake' snorting video emerges

image.altText: Notre Dame stained glass window showing a napping man.

props.synopsis: Humans didn't always sleep straight through the night, and we didn't always have to deal with a regulated work or school day. Modern culture is responsible for some of the most enduring misconceptions about sleep. Here are seven common myths.

title.children: Waking up in the middle of the night? You may be part of a tradition that has lasted centuries
